savedContentList.title: BIO 110 - Cell Biology

flashcards.definition: The basic structural and functional unit of all living organisms
The membrane-bound organelle that contains the cell's genetic material
The powerhouse of the cell, responsible for producing ATP through cellular respiration
Cellular structures responsible for protein synthesis
A network of membranes involved in protein and lipid synthesis
Organelle that modifies, packages, and ships proteins
Organelles containing digestive enzymes that break down waste materials
The selectively permeable barrier that surrounds all cells
The gel-like substance inside the cell membrane that contains organelles
Organelle in plant cells that conducts photosynthesis
Storage organelle that holds water, nutrients, and waste products
Rigid outer layer in plant cells that provides structural support
Adenosine triphosphate - the primary energy currency of cells
Deoxyribonucleic acid - the molecule carrying genetic instructions
Ribonucleic acid - involved in protein synthesis and gene expression
The movement of water across a semipermeable membrane
The passive movement of molecules from high to low concentration
Movement of molecules against concentration gradient using energy
Cell division resulting in two identical daughter cells
Cell division that produces four genetically different gametes
Process by which plants convert light energy into chemical energy
Process of breaking down glucose to produce ATP

savedContentList.description: A comprehensive study set covering fundamental cell biology concepts including cell structure, organelles, molecular biology, and cellular processes.

savedContentList.title: Psychology 101 - Key Concepts

flashcards.definition: The scientific study of behavior and mental processes
School of thought focusing on observable behaviors
Study of mental processes like thinking, memory, and problem-solving
Learning through association between stimuli (Pavlov)
Learning through consequences - rewards and punishments (Skinner)
Debate over genetic vs environmental influences on behavior
Chemical messengers that transmit signals between neurons
Brain region crucial for memory formation
Brain structure involved in emotional processing, especially fear
The primitive, instinctual part of personality seeking pleasure
The rational part of personality that mediates between id and superego
The moral conscience that internalizes societal rules
Theory of human motivation from basic needs to self-actualization
Tendency to seek information that confirms existing beliefs
Mental discomfort from holding contradictory beliefs
Bowlby's theory about the importance of early emotional bonds
Zimbardo's study on situational factors affecting behavior
Study on obedience to authority figures

groups.title: Foundations
groups.description: Basic concepts and schools of thought

savedContentList.description: Introduction to psychology covering major theories, brain structures, learning, and social psychology experiments.
